fragment.sub_volume_note: SCRIPTORES AETATIS INCERTAE EX ORDINE LITERARUM
fragment.author: CLEMENS
fragment.text: Κλήμης, ἱστορικός. Ἔγραψε Ῥωμαίων βασιλεῖς καὶ αὐτοκράτορας· καὶ πρὸς Ἱερώνυμον Περὶ τῶν Ἰσοκρατικῶν σχημάτων· καὶ ἄλλα. Eadem eudocia p. 267.
fragment.commentary: Clementem historicum, in quem verbs Suidiana (ἔγραψε ... αὐτοκράτορας) cadere possint, novimus chronographum, cujus saepe meminit Malalas (p. 34, 10. 228, 18. 231, 11. 240, 2. 242, 21. 280, 2. 428, 13 ed. Bonn.). Eundem laudant Cedrenus p. 19; Hesych. In fragm. in Christi natalem, Anonymus in Combefis. Origg. Constant. p. 32. Vixit homo post Justinianum (v. Malala p. 428, 13), ideoque ad nos nihil pertinet. Quod vero addit Suidas eundem scripsisse ad Hieronymum nescio quem (Rhodium peripateticum intelligit Westermannus Gesch. d. Bered. § 49, 1) περὶ Ἰσοκρατικῶν σχημάτων, aperte aliena miscuit, chronographum confundens cum grammatico, quem citant Etym. M. v. ζάλη, suidas v. ζάλην, Ἥρας, παλίμβολος, monente Ruhnkenio ad Tim. Lex. p. x. Conferri Bernbardyus et Westermannus jubent Ebertum in Disssertt. Sic. p. 150.
